men wit reason learned subtlety shall quickly discerned 3 rogero said secret sort ralucan castle went made watch guard vnpleasant sport comming might repent armes head cut short put flight gate peeces rent vnto wood entred met chance one alcynas men 4 〈…〉 man beare faulcon fist went hauking day day flie field riuer list countrie full game still yeelded pray spaniell could well mist eke hauking nagge verie gay meeting good rogero halfe disguised fled away straight surmised 5 seruant rideth meeting askt rogero rode fast rogero gaue verie slender greeting though squire little past well quoth faulkner though thou art fleeting truster long shew thee cast dogge faulcon horse doubt fetch thee backe force 6 first let faulcon take flight rabican fast flie horse faulkner doth alight horse flue like arrow went dogge course light wind bloweth skie last himselfe ran shift seemd lightning flame swift 7 rogero thinketh foule disgrace man thinke fled feare chase wherefore doth flight beare manfully turnes face seeing man faulkner weapon hand saw much disdaind sword draw 8 straight dog doth bite horse heeles hauke head amazed wing rabycan strange foe force feeles riseth vp behinde fling rogero thought world run wheeles rogeros 〈◊〉 balisarda brings seemd well seene fence blowes brought offence 9 loth stay resolued yeeld take target saddle bow dazling light sheeld whose force melyssa lately made know made fall eies seeld farther let grow hauing vanquisht wise ease may ride leasure please 10 foe foild force ouercome alcyna straight notice flight watchman one come thing done stand sight made stand like one halfe dead dumme put fright forthwith auoiding harme towne made crie alarme 11 calling oft selfe foolish beast rogero slipt somtime beates head face breast sometime rage garment ript calleth men least part vnto sea shipt rest make mightie band fetch rogero backe againe land 12 busie seruice bent none remaind pallace faire gard greatly helpt melyssas good intent chiefly haue hard set large poore prisners long pent absent hard dissoluing circle knot stroying figure lot 13 thus field house wood set large many found bene turnd tree stone flood state magicke art fast bound likewise rendred good saw themselues cleare vnbound departing thence hast might logestilia arriu • night 14 first chiefe rest english duke came himselfe againe rogero loud wisht best lends castle came found armour speare atcheeud sage frendly dame mount griffith horse without feare duke astolfo mounting crupper logestillas came night supper 16 rogero small tiring himselfe amid craggie wayes striuing paine may cut lothsome long delayes hindred sooner comming ladie faire whose vertues merit praise till neare southerne sea mickle paine came vnto sandy desert plaine 17 plagud thirst turnd backe askt meant maner brag cracke demaunded durst presume wo follow whose propertie claimed except would slaine maimed 29 orlando straight replide thou foolish beast saue see thou doest helmet want would ere haue taught thee least hereafter thy better vant ferraw doth thank • care ieast said shewd wit scant would afraid proue said 30 sir said orlando pagan king lend headpeece er go hence beast better order bring sharply punish offence nay soft said sacrapant thing grant might shew sence lend ile go schoole know well bob foole 31 tush quoth ferraw fooles face though bin disposd weare one would haue sufferd leiue loth best proudest beare one truth solemne oth vpon certaine chance forsweare one head helmet donne vntill orlando helmet wonne 32 quoth earle seems vnto thee thy force much orlando doth surmount thou couldst vnto almonta aspramount rather thinke thou face see thou wouldst farre wide thine account thou wouldst tremble ouer thy body yeeld thy selfe armour like nody 33 spanish vaunter like nation said often orlando met aduantage fashion lift might helmet get thus quoth time brings alteration seeke naught set take helmet spared little cared 34 straight orlando moud rightfull anger made answer thus thou foole murren lier cannot forbeare thee longer thou find doest desier met two thou didst part stronger thou thoughtst farder thou shalt feele nier try thou beest mind sad ill apaid heard newes found tracke though wait eury place laid vntill greekish pilgrim met inkling get 29 told certaine wanton dame hight origilla ruffian knaue kept openly without shame yet paine gracelesse couple heard betraid griffino diuellish traine hand aquilant giue pleasure securely liue 32 say aquilant god permission doth meet vile martano way horse coate outward apparition like vnto griffino eury way aquilant first without suspition went embrace began say brother well met ioy welfare absence bred much feare care 33 saw tother replide shrunke away like one afraid ah traitor villain yeeld thy selfe cride thou hast brother spoiled betraid tell thou wretch doth life abide humble sort martano said fainting hart quaking voice trembling yet midst feare dissembling 34 oh pardon sir brother aliue like liue hath hurt shall truth loth striue found stout tall ill intent drift contriue saue selfe hurt small woman sake sister open force daring assist 35 grieued see lust abuse nature made loue thought meet iust wicked custome remoue sith valew great mistrust thought best pollicie proue stale horse coate sleeping conuaid quite keeping 36 well might martano beare away bell else whetstone challenge dew sodaine tale could tell word tale trew put yet shew agreed well saue one aquilant certaine knew false vaine seeke smother bedfellow brother 37 hand tongue doth replie one instant strake spake know quoth vile villaine thou dost lie face fiercely strake make two teeth throate flie great violence doth take bind bitter band like captiues carrid forren land 38 thus hast satyre paena au • em vehemens mulio 〈◊〉 illu nocte die • • um portare pectore • estem ouid paenis • fa • • quror • pse 〈◊〉 though world beside could conceale yet doth soule within conscience grudge burden bide inward torment doth passe plague penance far away mortall man vpon sinne lay 21 sinne right may name one forst vnto thus friend hither came thinking thought meant none ill inforced perpetuall shame lawes honestie skill doubting would fact bewray forthwith gate hence fled away 22 though bodie haue desild yet mind sinne deuoid cleare although sight men exild dare publike place appeare • • thousand name reuild argeo tale heare beleeued straight withall intended punish neuer offended 23 taketh horse forthwith followth post reuenge mind wholly bent perfitly know cost brother faire softly went met hower bidding stand elíe shent brother would distwade might vaine argeo need would fight 24 tone strong full fresh disdaine tother weake l • th hurt frend himselfe defending long vaine brother constraind yeeld thend thus last prisner doth remaine yeelds himselfe vnable defend seene argeo doth surcease strike speaketh vnto word like 25 god neuer let heart farre moued rightfull wrath thy blood spill since thee esteemed well loued loued neuer kill though thy act may iustly reproued world shall see goodnesse thine ill • loue disdaine found better twaine 26 another meane death though long stay last striketh sure worthie saying worthie man thus much morall hipermestra daughter egittus egittus fiftie daughtershistorie caused maried danaos fifty sonnes commanded tyrannous father killed one night hipermestra refused obey filthie commandement saued husband whose name linus astolfo helpe booke dissolues inchanted pallaceallegorie horne draue away assaulted put great danger signifieth allegorically haue part touched wisdome helpe eloquence discouereth craftiest tameth wildest furder rogero casteth away inchanted shield refuseth vse thereof allegorie thereof signifieth though man necessitie sake sometimes driuen take helpes verie honorable sort sometimes reliue himselfe policy scarce commendable yet one vrgent necessitie past hurle conceipt may neuer found rogero flang shield well fame shall blow abrode noble mind rogeros refusing ayd force end annotation vpon xxij booke xxiii booke argvment astolfo griffith horse doth mount zerbin pinnabellos sworne since first noble hector armes wan side neuer sword worne iron weapon till get durindana orlando borne though gate well cannot scan since gate great report flie noble deed armes doth thereby 62 lesse quoth saine would wreake father death falfly betraid well wot sire weake christen ouerlaid orlando could chuse speake lie quoth thou hast said orlando beare sword durindan win weare 63 though sword iustly wholly mine yet time frankly agree shall neither mine thine combat vanquish takt thereat shall repine said hangd sword vpon tree indiffrently betweene stand vntill strife combat might scand 64 one thother ran couched speare headpeece strake staues sundry peeces rend teare blowes men small hurt take trunchens onely left foure blowes trunchens likewise brake thus saw weapon mist last forward next bradamants sorow want rogero morall may note falleth many time ouer great desire reuenge worketh selues great displeasure wished enemy rodomont would take horse hippalca till knew braue chāpion owner thereof may note though wrong deed thing reprouable soeuer done yet far tollerable least excusable done one equal poore inferior person zerbinos happie deliuerance shameful death orlando meanes may obserue neuer much obserued namely diuine prouidence neuer failes innocent proceeding zerbino isabella patterne might taken gratitude constantnesse noble princely inclination hercules antheus historie though originall selfe seeme fabulous yet thus written two wrastling hercules perceiued antheus strength increased falling ground therefore take force tooke vp armes held ground till vtterly vanquished plutarke life sertorius saith antheus threescore cubit high astolfo allegorie put armor gaue away spare horse superstuous weapon take griffith horse fly world may gathered good allegoricall sence rather may called theologicall namely betake himselfe high profession teach studie high mystery christen religion liue contemplation heauenly thing cast away burdenous clog worldly incumbrance vse phrase sauiour himselfe leaue father wife child whatsoeuer else may hinderance proceeding kind discourse fit another place selfe also handled amply little dialogue mariage made mine young dayes therefore cut auoiding tediousnesse concerning orlando madnesse notable allegorie gathered thereof haue taken vpon go thorow whole worke deferre speake till come restoring wit againe count proper subiect manner falling mad allusion author hath mine opinion shewd himselfe craft master setting verie pathetically speake english passionatly furder notable peripetia signifies agnition taking knowledge sudden mutation fortune either good bad contrarie extreame kind many example specially one mine author seemes allude namely oedipus sophocles messenger came tell death polybus elected king corinth oedipus refused come thither feare committing incest owne mother oracle foretold messenger thinking cleare scruple vnaduisedly told whose sonne knew thereby knew certainly mistrusted namely laine mother wherupon deed fell starke mad recured appeares storie end first xxiij bookes ariosto xxiiii booke argvment noble zerbin pardon doth afford odrik gabrina gracelesse payre turke fight orlando sword dy armes isabella faire fierce rodomont sundrie passion sturd doth fight cruell agricanes haire chief rage mistres parted whence ayd prince departed 1 sentence shall set cupid snare foote must seeke draw backe least caught madnes meer loue ouershoot 〈◊〉 virgil • aith dido • ri • infoelix dido tota • vagatur • rbe furens foole hath felt hath euer taught wise hath euer taught though alike take root yet shall finde loues thing naught sure sentence open signe madnes haue others pleasure breed thy sadnes sentence 2 though effect proue alike yet mad sort go astray simile wildernes men seeke seeking loose way wherefore let man wish mislike fond loue shall carie long sway wish due reward doting dolt like wilfull prisners store iron bolt 3 man perhap say soft frend spie fault owne error blind true yet speake end bring v better mind selfe hope er long mend band time selfe vnwind though hath tane root prooue hard ti sudden remoue 4 shewd booke went mishap orlando wared mad lost onely care vertues lore reason wit sence armor disperst cloth tore verie cloth wherewith corp clad though wanderd vnarmd naked yet presence countrie quaked 5 countrimen heard noise aloof tree fall made small cracke came neare saw plaine open proof mōstrous strength monstrous wracke straight found best behoof hast could get backe caught lesson teach sentence keep loof mad man reach 6 away fled pursud fast caught surprisd feare stood still oft happens agost knowing hide themselues wheare plowman seeing past thought little tarie theare climd feare house church trusting strength elmes beech burches 7 among rest take one heele head knock anothers braine caused paine feele till doom day neuer shall complaine another fist made reele till paine selfe made past sense paine men fled away affeard like rage set vpon heard 8 voice men bellowing beast countrie raysd great sound might haue well bene heard fiue leags least people straight raysed round man prouiding could best present time might found bow bill staues pike prong reuengd outragious wrong 9 simile looke waues driun westerne blast one one rise still vntill force great last sprinkle bank beat shore country folke came fast two three dozen score till last grew great number verie multitude themselues cumber 10 saw force could good skin strange protection though smot thereon drew blood thought yt might worse thought mad fight one withstood wherefore parted home dismaid sad madman went vnto nearest village although cared spoile pillage 11 finding man small great fled away thence aw famine forst sought meat fine course first saw greedie sort doth deuoure eat caring rosted raw thus homely tane repast countrie bedlemlike past 12 feares man beast without regard take swift gotes fallow deare chase sometimes lion fierce bore pard kils strength swiftnes pase last came knight guard returneth orlando 29 booke 41 staffe passage bridge place built towre small worke charge shalbe showd hereafter large 13 must tell hap zerbino faire isabell togither rode long place good earle fell mad way two made abode beheld two men armor clad driue horse bare wofull lode knight prisner zerbino knowne beene seruant owne 14 oderik taken prosoner brought zerbino prisner oderik biskie hight prince put great trust made chiefe choice knight promise would firme iust fond beast esteeming small delight fruitlesie hope vnbridled lust aboue sacred oth promist fealtie would haue defloured lealtie 15 faire isabell hap eun telling boat desperatly saued hauing scapt stormie sea swelling trecherouslie wretch himselfe behaued outlawes thereabout bene dwelling would haue forst vnto craued eun word sed saw man spake captiue led 16 two led wicked odrik tide knew well lord came vew lady side rampant lyon red hew borne prince shew pride predecesors dew light courtsie ground cap hand salute lord thus found 17 zerbino knew cald name corebo tone almonio tother hight two isabell bayon came conduct vnworthy wight straight almonio thus speech doth frame lord said shall recite little part vnpleasant story till houre made heart full sory 18 sith thankt god lady doth liue almonios speech felt storm therein chiefly smarted know thereof could notice giue hath er imparted onely shall declare grieue hapned since parted time vile wretch lewd intent horse men rochell sent 19 went backe turnd hast men horse good could get seeke mine eies cast yet mine eye could set tracke found following full fast brought wood met fellow coreb panting groning caitife cursing himselfe bemoning 20 told fighting defence isabella sorely wounded place sturred sence bleeding much oft sounded report tooke great offence wit welnie confounded reuenge heart sharpe whet corebs danger quite forget 21 vaine wretch long sought coreb returned backe againe weake low bleeding brought scant life limb remaine wofull state tooke great thought one deemd fitter ordaine priest frier buriall procure surgeon phisitions might forgiuen 34 force strong affection hath ere distemperd yea sometime ouerthrowne wiser staider head mine experience knowne dutie misse must confesse fault part mine owne gaue charge know quickly fancie guiding arriud houre twas night hap hast made riding sooner came seruants sight well could carry tiding looke prince oft giue use recompence bringing good newes 45 straight came met halfe way tooke fast necke kist told little stay anguish great sorrow mist cause alter mine array owne hand doth assist cawl gold set vpon crowne put rich stately gowne 46 part helpe matter take great heed said sober cast carrid still mine ey bare hand like maid voice serue worst yet thereby heed vsd sex bewraid thus arrayd princesse led many knight lady togither 47 looke clothes beguile thought woman beene honour done dutchesse queene made oftentime smile youth yeeres iudgment green cast vpon many wanton looke sex qualitie mistooke 48 last came meate store flesh fish kind tell ouerslip maidenly rast dislr wine scant wet lip time seemd long staid wanton wish still doubted taking trip bed time came told must bedfellow well pleased 49 maid page gone one onely lampe vpon cubbard burning cost cleare thus began anon faire dame thinke muse returning cause haue indeed muse thereon yesterday leaue mourning thinke thinke meet againe till god knowes 50 first let tell went come hereafter shall show deare ladie thus lament fruitlesse loue placed though could haue ay bene well content waite neuer part fro yet since presence make languish thought mine absence minish would anguish 51 riding way rage toward doth make minding make buy curtsie deare sure good richardetto repented cosin great art preuented 93 cofin malagige whose skill great doth magicke art pertaine word without booke could repeat coniure vp spryte hellish traine meanes work passing feat though namd place doth ordaine sprite doralices horse enter beare thence away aduenter 94 sprite thus coniurd quickly doth part damsel gentle nag crept quiet nature peruart one sudden thirtie foot lept ten foot high yet easie start doralicee still sadle kept yet cride doubt haue miscarried diuels name thence carried 95 forthwith sure worke enough 9 cause brother neuer went foorth gate rome scant life small good fortune hath lent hath enioyd quiet free strife left sire hath spent yet increast gaines rife thinke go pauy would moued regard 11 away post arriuing dayes rome brother house went earnest word brother prayes returne doth consent also sister loue allayes doth hold peace halfe content beside great thanks laying eye hart complaines absence sore grieue till returne doubt shall liue 13 ay thought quoth make fraid scant breath abideth brest peace sweete loue life iocundo said weepes fast comfort best may good fortune ay iourny aid returne threescore dayes least change day set thee downe though king would grat halfe crowne 14 might asswage woman paine two month long yea long cry need must die come againe keepe lite deuise dolefull dayes night shall sustaine meat mouth sleepe keepe mine eye iocundo readie repent brother giun consent 15 necke iewell rich ware crosse set stone gold well tride relicke ioy spoken although needed put mind time state sound broken absence long meane euer find quayle loue breath maintains life neither death 17 verie night went morrow pointed surely depart iocundos wife sicke sound sorrow amid armes heauie hart night wake bid godmorrow giue last farewell part iocundo way traine louing wife doth go bed againe 18 scant iocundo rode two mile forthright crosse came minde pillow laid last night hast left behinde would deuise scuse might excuse sufficient could finde loue must need much suspected finde precious iewell neglected 19 excuse within minde could frame seemed friuolous vaine send man counted shame go himselfe little paine staid brother ride soft quoth till returne againe home againe must nay ouertake way 20 thaffaire none doubt returne fast away spurres taduance rodomont doth meet way vallew good chance still many men arriues lost arm liues 41 among many prisners tooke christian algyre sent willd men safely looke ere long himselfe come ment rest saue armor forsooke harmelesse backe country went feat pagan wrought orlando thither came wit bestraught 42 instant orlando came rodomont armed saue hed naked earle wit quite frame leap bar went folly led passe bridge pagan doth blame presumption withall sed stay sawcy villen proud vndiscreet thee passage meet 43 lord knight squyres good estate bridge built thee thou beast sence idle pate heeding said season preuent worst beene cause ill mind offer alcesté furst win thereby fauor good went none doe trust mind herein sire mind fulfill offer mine owne selfe deuotion halfe realme accept motion 25 alcesté hearing came looke forth come al pale trembling like conquerour looke rather captiued man resembling found first plot forsooke well saw dissembling lowring looke held peace awhile fit estate framd stile 26 waxed bold see faint first cursed vnluckie loue crueltie made complaint harmd frends chiefe would proue haue constraint sharply reproue parted first deniall neuer sought make new frendly triall 27 told manner fierce though father iust suit denyed perhaps nature peruerse would first attempt plyed though good deed reuerse rather ought constancie haue tryed patient suffring painfull seruing come vnto reward well deseruing 28 father would haue beene wonne would said fauour haue procured would haue prayd make sonne found loue dured else secret would haue donne haue beene assured sith need would trie another meane told plaine loue alterd cleane 29 though came humble sort yeeld body price peace father held short intreated sue release yet vow • hoped sport offer force would cease sware rather selfe would kill grant ioyes constraind 30 word spake finding powre ouer great wherewith repentant make ere saint hermit desert seat fell downe foot prayd take naked dagger intreat stab hart take iust vengance lewd desart 31 saw passe thought follow great conquest end straight little hope brought fauour errour would mend father freedome might wrought state restord towne arly lay fiordeliege go towne land bradamant doth suburb stay thend may conuenient respite giue horse message deliuer 60 bridge gate quite past prayeth one kept ward bring rogero great hast towne curtsie guard done rogero came last message due regard gaue frontino went way would heare answer stay 61 rogero standeth still muse messenger message beguile wonder doth vse curtesie yet withall reuile think partie doth much abuse fowlest blot breach word file others least thought bradamant combat sought 62 thinke rodomont inclind yet could sinke reach sudden kind wherein could blame promise breach saue cannot call mind frendship breach ladie stately scorne token defiance blew horne 63 straightwayes news agramant doth fly one without challenge within serpentine chance askt leaue fight sured hope win swears knight yeeld else people flockt thicke thin stood vpon wall young old betweene two combat behold 64 serpentino came braue array brauely speare rest ran first encounter downe lay horse runnes leere away without man noble bradamant horse doth stay backe restore finely prayes king agramant speake send stronger knight sith weake 65 mightie king affricke spaine wall courteous act vew praising could notrefraine though none thereof author knew serpentino backe returnd againe prince told message trew champion desire fight stout renowned knight 66 grandonio fierce volaterne proudest knight spaine long time bred obtaind next place visage sterne threatning voice thus damsell sed curtsie small reward shall earne either fight must ded least prisner bring vnto marsilio great spaine king 67 well answerd keepe threat store villany curtfie shall let ile frendly monish backe againe vnto king get ere • may make body sore say desired haue met man indeed courage worth selfe last cameforth 68 replie mild yet bitter pagan furie enflame speare speech thought answer fitter toward full carreer came intending sure deadly blow hit accustomd game bare well blow goldélance taught contains kind excesse meat drinke surely must grant realme england hath bin noted sorriot meat many yeares since without cause though alone plato found like fault italie time vice drinking name health ouerthrowes health sobrietie growne vsuall dious tother doubt easily driuen sodainly crept haue beard prettie tale impertinent matter gentleman sonne vniuersitie like good conscience v kind take haue wit would leaue least lose next news heard amendment began follow woman touched father somwhat nearer yet replied againe made question would leaue ere long owne ease therefore yet would dispaire last newes heard began mend former two fault fell bilbing drinking vpon villan said father surely disinherit fault elder waxeth wilbe subiect wherefore conclude morall exhortation wit cannot make men leaue play owne ease make theē eschew venerie least let vglynes openesse beastlines sin make leaue hath defence praise say praise scripture saith wicked man • praised wickednes neuer heard praise layd chopped surely mind bloudie stroke necke smit felt like stroke eun fight thereof 8 slauonian vile didst thou learne know lawes warre within scuthian land vse men kill prisner taken yeelds hath weapon hand grieuous sinne trow foe deare country withstand hast thou sunne long age shinde breed atrews thiestes kinde 9 barbarian vile kild sweet youth satisfie thy rancor thy rage rare youth confesse truth match could found age whose beautie might haue bred sufficient ruth fierce poliphemus anger asswage fierce thee cruell fell monster desert dwell 10 valiant men studie time past euer bene detested contrary warlike discipline kill haue weapon hand wherefore noble prince euer make faire warres pirthus said ennius quorum virtuti belli fortuna pepercit horundem libertati parcere certum est whose life fortune warres doth saue frankly graunt freedome haue crueltie euer proceeds vile mind often cowardly heart haue nothing mind mouthes mortui non mordent beside vnchristen also false scripture saith blood abel cried vengeance better approued prouerbe england blood haue blood bradamant note bad effect iealousie rogero long forbearance last thought reuenged marfisa may see laesa patientia fit furor patience prouoked turnes furie historie cantelmus whose death much bewailed taken ambushment venetian armie hauing couragiously sallied cut though iouius writes wil another companion scaped hardly cantelmus head chopt side galley sight father crueltie ariosto iustly inueyeth astianax sonne hector credible author write throwne downe high towre vlysses bloudie pollicie law woman fauour 1 worthie lady would take paine praise 〈◊〉 study immortall glorie raise often take matter vaine deseruing none little praise notwithstanding might obtain haue employed many night dayes haue thereby trifling want supplied niggard nature denied 2 could owne pen set forth worthie praise owne kind beholding vnto men hate enuie often doth blind make v heare good eurie place full ill find sure iudge praise would hardly men haue attaind much 3 many writer onely striue highly extoll sex fame thinke must withall contriue publish woman blemish blame fearing haply lest might arriue due desart greater name might thereby obscure praise doth cloud sunnes bright shining rayes 4 yet sparing pen write lauish • gues speake disgrace enforcing eurie il report spite may credit slander deface still shall find glorie shining bright still shall see keepes worthie place though wanting height greater part attaine desart 5 harpalicé thomeris besidel •• ke 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 turnus hector ayd besides dame ox hide first foundation faire carthage layd zenobia eke quayld pride assur inde persia frayd say haue bin many thease haue bin famous land sea 6 rome greece haue bred store faithfull matron chast stout wise world beside lesse whence set sun doth rise though name obscured sore none laid eys dayes wrate enuious false full hate 7 yet cease lady ye vertue loue follow course good way let feare mind remoue great fame hereafter may decay true 〈◊〉 daylie proue good ill still stand stay though writer time past frends present time shall make large amends 8 worthie writer present time bred 1 〈…〉 faire lady gracious eare heare present storie seemes see vnwóted changing cheare rogero offended thus againe departing deare take ill though thought durst affirme boldly fire loue burne coldly 2 sure bin moued hereunto cause told though thereby attained rich crassus wealth richer cresus gold yet would thinke seemes ye loues dart tane shallow hold sweet ioy thought gold siluer neuer could bought 3 one honour shall thereon depend merit excuse praise chiefe one truly may pretend cannot saue honor otherwayes woman herselfe bend stop prayre delayes giue iust cause eurie one guesse loue little wit lesse 4 woman loues esteeme life safetie owne speake whose choice change remoues whose affection rashly growne sure much reason behoues honour care showne much due account pleasure life selfe surmount 5 following lord faithfully rogero eun bound haue left thinke haue done slender ground▪ though almonti made father die agramant fault could redound ancestor offence giun rogero many recompences 6 well going lord well cannot denied thereto granted accord might hap haue stopt replied liking abhord want henceforth may supplied honor haue one minuts slainesentence hundred yeares scant cleanse againe 7 • rogero vnto arly went dutie bound traianos haire vnto christen campe incontinent rogeros spouse sister noble paire louing frends co • n went vnto charles tent repaire mind siege battels doubtfull chance driue tedious trouble france 8 campe made knowne bruted bradamant come noblest brother came forth kindly saluted guidon though came sundry mother sexe calling suted resalute diuers others kissing speaking best making frendly gesture rest 9 marfisas name heard knowne whose noble act eun catay spaine ouer world beside blowne looke glad faine presse thrust ouerthrowne scarse aman could tent remaine heauing shouing hitherward thither see braue paire togither 10 charles presence come vpon knee marfisa decline turpino writes man see knee touch ground time plentie bird coigne stamped appeares plutarke life lysander laid charge grèat officer named gilippus roosted many owles penthouse house indeed money stole kinde coigne hidden crocodile nilus famous neither beast riuer one affrica called senega fall atlanticke ce amand hath crocodile hold arme nilus though opinion little reason say lundy ile betweene cornwall wale part ireland hath snake crocodile count worth noting bred egge groweth twelue fourteene foot long creature doth beside hanniball ouercome scipio fled antiochus doubting sickle disposition went prusia king bithinia counsell policie ouercame eumenes sea fight benefite seruice notwithstanding said prusia would haue betrayed romanes hanniball seeing meanes escape tooke poyson carried purpose ring made away himselfe iugurth likewise betaking himselfe protection boccus king mauritania sonne law taken bound deliuered sylla caried marius whose triumph led rome forced write leape high arch haue starued inprison pompey vanquished caesar fled egipt ptolomey whose father bene much beholding time past pompey feare caesar displeasure made head cut allegoriein rogero notwithstanding oths promise marrie bradamant become christian yet regard wordly reputation caried away taketh shipping affrica may allegorically vnderstood sence vnderstanding hauing helpe grace confirme carried away sea error •• ssed waues diver tale truth likelyhood doth misse 23 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 43 〈◊〉 144 orlando looking shore little frigot farre deserie sayle helpe ore vnto ile seemd great hast flie ere tell must france fast hie see merrie sad confesse two knauish tale booke yet bee picke hony worst mine owne part haue euer bene opinion tale mantuan knight simply worst woman booke rather indeed euer written host tale xx viij booke worke bad one spencer take squire dame excellent poem faery queene end vij canto third booke like effect sharpe well conceited substance thus squire dame could three yeares trauell find three woman denyed lewed desire three one courtesan reiected wanted coyne second nun refused would swear secreacie third plain countrey gentlewoman good honest simplicitie denyed also hath liknes pharao spake note vpon 42 book mantuan knight passeth thē marke secret drift shewing woman excellent education great learning rare beautie fine wit choise quality sweet behauiour aboundant wealth dearly beloued husband could easily conquerd sight three four iewels comfort ten yeares great house keeper married guest came spilt drinke bosomes tale admitting true probable would argue woman exceeding couetousnes loe easily onely excused retorted vpon men assuredly onely couetouseness men maketh woman interpret sell chastity woman indeed care nothing loued assure themselues loued kind sweet disposition bestow loue againe men protest sweare vow thinke therefore maruel woman hard beliefe thicke listed heare come giue thing cost money coyn begin walke sure men esteeme dearly venter body soule many time maruell belieue thinke good earnest consequently yeeld denyed go forward rest morall men woman may gather morall tale vice odious base bodie hired vnto shamefull detestable faery manto cannot affirme thing truth historie whether faery prophetesse finde wrtiten thebs razed alexander manto daughter tyresia learned magike well father came vnto part italy mantua sonne ocnus virgil haue built citie called mother name ille etiam patrijs ignem ciet ocnus ab oris fatidicae mantus thusei filius amnis qui muros matrisque dedit tibi mantua nomen concerning braue men orlando compareth brandimart decij curtius codrus decij one dreame vision told battel fight next day latin captain one side army side perish wherupō consul ran wilfully enemy slaine gat victory roman son decius like curtius lept gulfe prophecyed neuer stopt till precious iewell roman thrown codrus dyed thus dorian hauing warre athenian oracle told athens codrus slaine enemy athenian haue victorie newes noised dovians campe gaue straight charge none kil codrus minding dye defence countrie countersaited himselfe like pedler like came campe enemy picking quarrell purpose souldiers slaine among cuppe presented renaldo allusion allegorically vnderstood suspition whosoeuer drinketh great od shed bosome shal drinke worse liues therfore renaldo said wel drinke cup quoth list minde drie mantuans tale allegorie vnlike cephalus ouids metamorphosis seuenth booke tels like sort changed negromancy tempted wife farre dum census dare promitto loquendo muneraque augendo tandem dubitare coegi haue heard gentleman would need court owne wise maske causing told man made loue long till found himselfe gracious cause beast faery manto whether faery wil dispute matter haue heard strange tale reported credible person witch spirit whatsoeuer haue heard often among simpler sore please queene faery shall neuer want liues seemes like opinion hath crept country though taken fable saying may paternoster indeed sure neuer shall come creed marrie shaghaird dog could dance please lady well pretie quality dare vndertake seruant bungy whose picture may see first page booke knowne best lady england may cōpare pilgrim dog serued saint seuen yere want qualitie shake duckats eares leaue toying tale fall soberer matter solemne suneralls brandimart orlando mourning alludes buriall pallas pallante virgil bardino acetes orlando aenas set forth denout christian termes therefore commended end note 43 booke xliiii booke argvment renaldo rogero giues sister duke ammon mother rogero doubting lest haue mist vowes leon father kill leaueth france 4 ti manifest story new old good ill succeed worldly blisse hath slender hold wherefore man wisedome take heed fortune neuer bold although state rich farre exceed yet fortune ill dispaire doubt euermore wheele doth turne 5 rogero lately repeat hauing repulst sonne fire grew pride therewith conceat ambition euermore aspiring hire thinkes fortune force great kill leon chiefe desire purpose aid asketh none thinketh sure fear alone 6 cannot suffer abide long fauour bost midst praise pride fauour affied cause knight discride went vnto vngardo straight post told man put flight greekish host charles great began call minde promise himselfe bound husband none euer assinde bradamant fight found match king vse kinde published trumpet found empire sending proclamation soone flye forren nation 20 thus much writing made men vnderstand man bradamant wife get one would attempt sword hand rising sun vntill set force single combat withstand could let agrees charles himselfe allows one haue spouse 21 article likewise set downe name weapon list vallew great renowne fight horse foote field list duke ammon withstand crowne want force longer doth resist long discourse daughter compeld fine backe court broughther 22 mother eke though wroth malcontent yet nature honour sake good store costly clothes incontinent gownes kirtle doth make thus bradamant parent went vnto court small ioy take scarce esteemed court louer could see 23 〈◊〉 one saw aprill may pleasant garden full fragrant flowres fresh earth new clad garment gay deckes eury wood groue pleasant bowres come againe december day see mard winter stormes showres court bradamant appeare saw rogero heare 24 dare aske man feare least question might loue accuse beit secretly lendeth eare others talke case men vse man saith gon none knowes wheare court came newes himselfe thence departed purpose vnto man imparted 25 oh feare rage newes set heare rogero manner fled think sure could get father nay sed sought purpose forget shunne sight sorrow bred think thence himselfe withdrawes alone none cause 26 doubt heart assayles gone seeke forren loue sith purpose fayles speed otherwhere straight would proue simile boord men driue nayles nayles new loue woud loue remoue straight another thought thought gainsaith thinketh rogero full faith 27 therevpon selfe reprehends louer much abuse thus minde one fancie defends another doth sore accuse thought either fancie lends great doubt part chuse selfe bethought leaneth vnto best pleasing thought 28 chiefe mind doth repeat rogeros promise bad trust think iniurie great causlesly mistrust eun present doth beat brest still doth harbor thought vniust selfe hath sinnd saith curse caused cause worse 29 loue cause quoth hart face grace ingraued hath seemely therewith hath set forth vertuous part beseeming thee sweetly trimly sure dame knowes well thou art chuse fall loue thee extreemly therewithall powre indeuer win thy loue make thee euer 30 oh loue graud thy thought well hath graud thy visage minde great ioy blisse dwell well know true kinde iealousie onely plague hell ala much inclinde quickly cease free would heart thinke vpon 31 miser hoording vp treasure simile doth doubt absence still theeues thou art mine onely pleasure art absent far know straight suspect straight doubt false measure straight hope grows lesse feare though thinke bootlesse vniust yet still doubt still mistrust 32 yet sooner shall pelasing light thy sweet countnance come vnto mine eye thou ioy ô thou line delight though thou art cannot deuise true hope false feare shall put flight knowledge plaine doubt shall satisfie come deare hasten thy returning ere hope feare shal wast quite mourning 33 night hath spred mantle blacke simile faint harted folke wont affrayd againe daylight doth come backe seeme better cheare well appayd faint deare lacke presence vndismayd come deare rogero come vnto hope doubt quite vndo 34 night little fierie sparke simile may plainly discerned eyne day doth come shall marke dampt longer shine kindels feare minde doubt made darke vntill sunne horizon shine turne deare thy light illume driue away care doth consume 35 sun decline south low simile land doth ieese beautie winter stormes breed raine ise snow pleasant bird silent sit sad thou farre dost go shining sunne whose beames make glad thousand feares vniust vaine make winter heart great paine 36 shine cleare sun bring thy beames nye snow ise thaw refresh branch witherd spring thy selfe farre withdraw philomena dolefully doth sing 〈◊〉 young one destroyd saw turtle early mourns late hath lost deare beloued mate 37 noble bradamant still mournes plaines feare rogeeo loue reiected salt teares louely cheek distaines yet secretly feare detected oh knowne bound chaines eurie houre cruell death expected griefe minde thinke would take grieud alreadie sake 38 loe heaunly goodnes ordaines theodoras rage cruell spight prisner keep chaines mean kil torture might reseruing aliue greater paine came eare caesar sonne one night put heart saue cherish suffer great vallew perish 39 noble leon rogero loues knowing tho rogero rare vertue great vallew moue thinke humane farre passe deuising sundry wayes one proues brought feate passe cruell ant could espy complaine wronged 40 speaketh secretst sort vnto bloudy wretch kept kayes prayth show condemned man must examaine sayes knight valiant man man take fit bold assayes cruell layler fraud suspected point leon directed 41 lead secretly vnto den good rogero prison pent tooke men guide formost went saw time best serued longer defer thoccasion ment vnawares aduantage catch sodaine stab dispatch 42 open trap doore hand downe let ladder leon lanterne hand light conceald went knight ly fast bound vpon grate bitter band water thereto ny dampe one might guesse • ole would kill month lesse 43 great compassion leon imbraced sayd sir knight vertue haue showne sured knot loue hath knit laced since first knowne heart thought wholly placed seeke fafetie rather mine owne ventring welfare loue win leese fire good kin 44 tell true emprours sonne leon name yet stranger set free purpose came put person state danger father greatly may blame looke vpon euermore anger losse belgrade wrought late make beare sharpe hate 45 sugred word many beside tedious repeat spake band vntyde secretly causd moue seat rogero wise replyde curtesie gift great giue life shall ay command euer shall please demand 46 thus leon secret sort vnknowne rogero prison doth conuay sent castle owne whereas might secure silence stay vntill tumult ouerblowne till againe regaine may armes gallant horse famous blade kept vngardo lord noueng • ade 47 keeper slaine next ensuing morne prison gate hinge heaued chaines manicles peeces torne man might see none perceaued thought leon hatred borne wherefore mistrust conceaued cause hate man doth know name late receaued ouerthrow 48 great curtesie leon vsed rogero wonder much think strange sore minde thought confused sodainly feeles wondrous change heart relented hate refused turnde loue sweet exchange earst malicious cruell hatefull turned kinde milde gratefull 49 deepe head heart sinkes possessed soule sence study wake winkes may recompence spend eun future dayes thinkes sole seruice defence could requite scarce twentith part great curtsie great desart 50 meane newes come france charles notifide many nation would wood sword lance single fight said proclamation leon quite countenance heare strange determination man well owne strength knowes himselfe weake doth suppose 51 long debating might supply want force courage wit fine purposd himselfe try new made fréd whose name know yet although well could witnesse eye braue exploit vnfit hopeth manhood aid conquer haue hardie maid 52 two thing must go one minde vnknowne knight vnto hardie enterprise dispose tother bring fight secretly none might disclose keepe himselfe fight first earnest sort doth intreat rogero take hardie feat 53 much might greeke preuaile eloquence vsd leade thereunto preuayld bond recompence firme time euer could vndo though motion bred great offence seemd thing vnpossible gladder looke heart doth reply deare sir nothing may deny 54 though sooner word pronounced felt griefe gripe hart damnation denounced pang torture smart yet promise giun renounced purposd depart first thousand death ment chuse one request leon refuse 55 dye sure shall think leaue loue knowes cannot byde aliue either sorrow life reaue nature shall sorrow striue owne hand death receaue soule hated harbor driue thing mishap tree caue close hidden lye bradamant rage anger driuen aslayld rogero signe giuen 70 〈◊〉 neuer stiffe aged oke northerne blast firmely stand 〈◊〉 better doth rocke indure stroke surging waues many houres liue well without soule without hold vitall powres sure ti best behoofe liue lawfull two betrotht law allowes one woman one spouse 21 leon newes accrazed seemed traunce knew rogero stedfastly gazed euer mouing lip hand brow like image long stood amazed hath hallowd performe vow act curteous doth weene think like neuer beene 22 knew name repent good done rather greatly increase proceeding course begunne wherefore shew great stocke came indeed emperiors sonne although thing inferior courtesie meanes superior 23 thus said deare rogero know well knowne person meanes ouerthrow foyled men yet great vertue show eun manner like haue moud would malice haue remoued would vertue great haue loued 24 dislike rogeros name knew must need confesse continue assure selfe purpose nothing lesse first prison came set free danger distresse knowne truth yet vow would haue done 25 surely would haue done reason haue borne hate much rather ought vngrate vnthankfull men sith loue life whole estate haue freely giuen gaue againe freely shall haue 26 due damzell though much esteeme due desart yet much misse straightwayes griefe thereof kil hart shall death auantage sith alreadie claime part lawfully abide life meanes anothers wise 27 part first quite forsake worldly ioyes beside shall said may sake noble knight great worth dide onely thing could vnkindly take kindnes tride would rather chuse end day griefe hand haue comfort reliese 28 word leon spake many would tedious recite refuting good rogero euermore conclusion vanquisht quite said yeeld ile resist die shall requite courtesie twise haue giuen life greatest woe driuen 29 melissa caused brought cordiall meates wine puruaying made take ye thought tasting long eun almost decaying horse likewise nature hath taught came heard horse naying leon cauld lackies get saddle backe let 30 rogero leon aid much adoe clammer feat greatly former strength decaid ouerthrew army great lately withstand warlike maid weakly weapond repeat thus conuenient speed might brought abbey night 31 night three dayes ensewd staid needfull thing good store vntill rogero strength renewd fasting long bene weakned sore priuily among conclude turne paris night bulgarian came embassage substance message 32 said people nation rogero late aid bring beyond hope beyond expectation therefore chosen king reiecting owne king generation royall race vsuall thing much loued well leeke therefore sent charles court seeke 33 rogeros lackey bene guide told cake master frends sped namely greekes damnifide bulgars hauing lost hed chose king alone ride nouengrade rane bed vnto theodora presented purposed haue sore tormented 34 heard commonly spoken cruell keeper closely slew prison gate rent broken gone whither man knew rogeros man thing open rogero closely men vew come towne night stay leon came charles next day 35 leon arme arme rogero led thus deuised betweene selfe cote armes apparelled late people seene dame bradamant combated leon falsely weene batterd sword cote plume torne headpeece rogero worne 36 man eun first fight surmised knight ladie wonne leon selfe bare faced vndisguised came richly clothed like emprors sonne retinue dispised charles due reurence donne rogero hand take eye fixt thus spake 37 stout well approued knight bradamant fight hand hand sith neuer tooke put flight twelue houres force withstand worthy sir haue ought right edict rightly vnderstand therefore accordingly commeth lay claime best becommeth 38 besides right proclamation knowne iustly doth others claime debarre thinke vallew hath showne proues sufficiencie feates warre loue may win sure owne loue doth passe others farre stand prepared auer law force hath right 39 king charles court greatly muse till little thought much abuse himselfe combat fought marfisa flying newes strange report thither brought scant end speech would permit presently wife answerd 40 sith rogero absent hence might right knight defend proue vaine pretence strife shal easely end sister defense defence cause intend fight whomsoeuer place shall deny title disgrace 41 last word spake desdaine knew nature hastie euer feare scantly would eun refraine without leaue kill straight endeuer leon think best longer faine forthwith pulling rogero beauer loe himselfe readie prest said answer shall charge laid 42 smile looke historie old aegeus cursed boord amazed sat finde looke much bookes youth inclined hand somewhat drie little bowlegged counterfeit taken tytiano excellent drawer well life man would thinke yet aliue honoured lawrell hand renowned emperour charles fist yeare 1532 yeare hee dyed disposition haue partly touched nature assable proud taking lesse vpon others yeeld vnto yet putting vp knowne iniurie better somewhat amorous youth secret passing studious nature fearefull vpon water therefore hee went shippe time would see others go vsing saying de puppo neunssimus exi though mine owne part see great reason venturous horsebacke say would light every place danger though others rode ouer loued go much abroad owne countrey much writes one satyres che vuol andare torne torne vada vegga ingleterra vngheria francia e spagna ame piace habitar lamia contrada vista ho thosana lombardia romagna quel monte che diuide e quel che serra italia e vn mare e laltro che la bagna questo mi basta il resto della terra senza mai pagar lhoste andro
